pull.title: guix: documented shasum gathering command
pull.body:
When a PR requires proof of Guix builds (sha256sums), the PR author or reviewer uses a not well documented command to collect the sha256sums of build outputs or manually gathers them from files.

This pull request introduces a new section in the documentation, providing some documentation on the command's functionality and usage.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/33472. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | ACK | [Sjors](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33472#issuecomment-3799552761) | | Stale ACK | [trevarj](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33472#issuecomment-3327942653) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore.
Addressed all the feedback (including the linter's spelling suggestion )

Addressed in :0a97da9

- added `uname -m`
- added command for tag-based checkouts.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -103,6 +103,20 @@ worktree to save disk space:
 ./contrib/guix/guix-clean
 ```
 
+## Gathering shasums of build outputs
+
+After a successful build, the shasums of the build outputs are gathered
+into a file named `SHA256SUMS`. These files are located in each of the
+architecture-specific output directories.
+
+To gather all shasums and output them together to console, for e.g.
+inclusion in a Guix pull request comment, run:
+
+``` sh
+guix describe
comments.body: the guix builds use a time machine, so the description of the host guix should be irrelevant and is confusing to put here, no?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -103,6 +103,20 @@ worktree to save disk space:
 ./contrib/guix/guix-clean
 ```
 
+## Gathering shasums of build outputs
+
+After a successful build, the shasums of the build outputs are gathered
+into a file named `SHA256SUMS`. These files are located in each of the
+architecture-specific output directories.
+
+To gather all shasums and output them together to console, for e.g.
+inclusion in a Guix pull request comment, run:
+
+``` sh
+guix describe
+uname -m
comments.body: I think it is easier to keep this a one-line, to make copy-pasting easier?

comments.body:
Just tried to stay as close to the found command :
https://github.com/fanquake/core-review/tree/master/guix#build-output

Have changed it

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -103,6 +103,20 @@ worktree to save disk space:
 ./contrib/guix/guix-clean
 ```
 
+## Gathering shasums of build outputs
+
+After a successful build, the shasums of the build outputs are gathered
+into a file named `SHA256SUMS`. These files are located in each of the
+architecture-specific output directories.
+
+To gather all shasums and output them together to console, for e.g.
+inclusion in a Guix pull request comment, run:
+
+``` sh
+guix describe
+uname -m
comments.body:
Please keep `uname -m`, as different build platforms may produce different output, which could lead to cross-platform non-reproducibility:

```
uname -m && ...
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -103,6 +103,18 @@ worktree to save disk space:
 ./contrib/guix/guix-clean
 ```
 
+## Gathering shasums of build outputs
+
+After a successful build, the shasums of the build outputs are gathered
+into files named `SHA256SUMS`. These files are located in each of the
+architecture-specific output directories.
+
+To gather all shasums and output them together to console, for e.g.
+inclusion in a Guix pull request comment, run:
+
+``` sh
+find guix-build-$(git rev-parse --short=12 HEAD)/output/ -type f -print0 | env LC_ALL=C sort -z | xargs -r0 sha256sum
comments.body: `$(git rev-parse --short=12 HEAD)` won't work for tags. However, that's not the case for pull requests.

@@ -103,6 +103,25 @@ worktree to save disk space:
 ./contrib/guix/guix-clean
 ```
 
+## Gathering shasums of build outputs
+
+After a successful build, the shasums of the build outputs are gathered
+into files named `SHA256SUMS`. These files are located in each of the
+architecture-specific output directories.
+
+To gather all shasums and output them together to console, for e.g.
+inclusion in a Guix pull request comment, run:
+
+For branch- or PR-based checkouts, use:
+``` sh
+uname -m && find guix-build-$(git rev-parse --short=12 HEAD)/output/ -type f -print0 | env LC_ALL=C sort -z | xargs -r0 sha256sum
+```
+
+For tag-based checkouts, use:
+``` sh
+uname -m && find guix-build-$(git describe --tags --exact-match | sed 's/^v//')/output/ -type f -print0 | env LC_ALL=C sort -z | xargs -r0 sha256sum
+```
